newsitem.title: CANADA: Small earthquake rattles Canada's West Coast.
newsitem.headline: Small earthquake rattles Canada's West Coast.

text.p: A small earthquake centred off Canada's Pacific Coast jolted Vancouver and the surrounding area Friday morning, the Geological Survey of Canada said.
The tremor was estimated to measure 3.5 on the open-ended Richter scale, a spokesman for the agency said.
The epicentre was about 18 miles (30 km) off the coast in the waters of the Strait of George between mainland British Columbia and Vancouver Island, he said.
The earthquake struck shortly before 7 a.m. and residents along the West Coast reported feeling a swift jolt. There were no reports of serious damage or injury.
